title: Tata Harrier, Altroz, Punch get up to Rs 1.4 lakh discount in June
description: Tata Motors is rolling out compelling discounts and offers this month on the Harrier, Punch, Nexon, Altroz (pre-facelift), Curvv, Safari, Tiago, and Tigor. The benefits can be availed in the form of cash discounts, corporate offers, or exchange/scrappage bonuses, and are available on both MY2024 and MY2025 stock, but the Curvv misses out on the latter. MY2025 Altroz units also come with an additional cash discount. Tata Harrier and Safari get maximum discounts of Rs 83,000 Altroz Racer discounted by up to Rs 1.40 lakh this month Nexon features up to Rs 45,000 in discounts Disclaimer: Discounts vary from city to city and are subject to stock availability. Please check with your local dealer for exact figures. Tata Harrier, Safari discounts in June 2025 Up to Rs 83,000 off Dealers who still have inventory of MY2024 Harrier and Safari are offering benefits worth up to Rs 83,000 on all variants of both SUVs. This includes a cash discount of Rs 50,000, exchange/scrappage bonuses of Rs 25,000, and corporate offers of Rs 8,000. For the MY2025 models, the Smart and Fearless trims of the Harrier and Safari attract benefits of up to Rs 58,000, while all other variants get discounts of Rs 83,000. The Harrier’s price starts at Rs 15 lakh and tops off at Rs 26.50 lakh, while the Safari costs between Rs 15.50 lakh and Rs 27.25 lakh. Tata Altroz, Altroz Racer discounts in June 2025 Up to Rs 1.40 lakh off Tata recently launched the facelifted Altroz, and is offering hefty discounts on the outgoing model. The MY2024 Altroz Racer variants get total benefits of up to Rs 1.40 lakh this month - comprising a Rs 85,000 cash discount, Rs 50,000 exchange/scrappage bonus, and Rs 5,000 corporate offer. Meanwhile, all MY2024 petrol, CNG, and diesel variants of the Altroz get benefits to the tune of Rs 1.05 lakh. All MY2025 Altroz variants have benefits worth up to Rs 70,000, which includes a Rs 20,000 cash discount, Rs 25,000 exchange/scrappage bonus, Rs 20,000 additional cash discount, and Rs 5,000 corporate offer. Priced at Rs 6.89-11.49 lakh, the Altroz facelift remains the only hatchback in India to currently offer a diesel engine, and rivals  the Maruti Suzuki Baleno, Toyota Glanza, and Hyundai i20. Tata Punch discounts in June 2025 Up to Rs 28,000 off Tata’s smallest SUV, the Punch, has total benefits of up to Rs 28,000 - comprised of a Rs 25,000 cash discount and Rs 3,000 corporate offer - on MY2024 models in June. MY2025 Punch models, meanwhile, get a Rs 10,000 cash discount, Rs 15,000 exchange/scrappage bonus, and Rs 3,000 corporate offer, making for maximum benefits of Rs 28,000. Prices for the Hyundai Exter rival start at Rs 6.20 lakh and go up to Rs 10.32 lakh. Tata Nexon discounts in June 2025 Up to Rs 45,000 off The Nexon has benefits of up to Rs 45,000 on MY2024 models, which includes a Rs 35,000 cash discount and Rs 10,000 exchange/scrappage bonus. Meanwhile, MY2025 Nexon models offer only an exchange/scrappage bonus of Rs 15,000. Notably, the Nexon does not get any corporate offers this month. Priced between Rs 8 lakh and Rs 15.60 lakh, the Nexon rivals the Skoda Kylaq, Kia Sonet, and Mahindra XUV 3XO. Tata Tiago, Tigor discounts in June 2025 Up to Rs 50,000 off Tata’s most affordable offerings - the Tiago and Tigor - get maximum discounts of up to Rs 40,000 and Rs 50,000 respectively on MY2024 stock. Meanwhile, MY2025 Tiagos (other than the base XE trim) and Tigors get total benefits of up to Rs 30,000 and Rs 35,000 respectively.  The Tiago price starts at Rs 5 lakh and tops off at Rs 8.85 lakh, while the Tigor compact sedan costs between Rs 6 lakh and Rs 9.55 lakh. Tata Curvv discounts in June 2025 Up to Rs 30,000 off All petrol and diesel variants of the Curvv made in 2024 get a cash discount of up to Rs 30,000 this June. There are, however, no benefits on MY2025 units of the Tata Curvv, nor does Tata offer any corporate discountsfor the coupe SUV. The Citroen Basalt and Hyundai Creta rival is currently priced between Rs 10 lakh and Rs 19.52 lakh, and got a Dark Edition back in April. All prices, ex-showroom, India. html:
Eight Tata models are available with enticing benefits throughout the month.

Tata Motors is rolling out compelling discounts and offers this month on the Harrier, Punch, Nexon, Altroz (pre-facelift), Curvv, Safari, Tiago, and Tigor. The benefits can be availed in the form of cash discounts, corporate offers, or exchange/scrappage bonuses, and are available on both MY2024 and MY2025 stock, but the Curvv misses out on the latter. MY2025 Altroz units also come with an additional cash discount.

  1. Tata Harrier and Safari get maximum discounts of Rs 83,000
  2. Altroz Racer discounted by up to Rs 1.40 lakh this month
  3. Nexon features up to Rs 45,000 in discounts

Disclaimer: Discounts vary from city to city and are subject to stock availability. Please check with your local dealer for exact figures.

Tata Harrier, Safari discounts in June 2025

Up to Rs 83,000 off

Dealers who still have inventory of MY2024 Harrier and Safari are offering benefits worth up to Rs 83,000 on all variants of both SUVs. This includes a cash discount of Rs 50,000, exchange/scrappage bonuses of Rs 25,000, and corporate offers of Rs 8,000. For the MY2025 models, the Smart and Fearless trims of the Harrier and Safari attract benefits of up to Rs 58,000, while all other variants get discounts of Rs 83,000. The Harrier’s price starts at Rs 15 lakh and tops off at Rs 26.50 lakh, while the Safari costs between Rs 15.50 lakh and Rs 27.25 lakh.

Tata Altroz, Altroz Racer discounts in June 2025

Up to Rs 1.40 lakh off

Tata recently launched the facelifted Altroz, and is offering hefty discounts on the outgoing model. The MY2024 Altroz Racer variants get total benefits of up to Rs 1.40 lakh this month - comprising a Rs 85,000 cash discount, Rs 50,000 exchange/scrappage bonus, and Rs 5,000 corporate offer. Meanwhile, all MY2024 petrol, CNG, and diesel variants of the Altroz get benefits to the tune of Rs 1.05 lakh.

All MY2025 Altroz variants have benefits worth up to Rs 70,000, which includes a Rs 20,000 cash discount, Rs 25,000 exchange/scrappage bonus, Rs 20,000 additional cash discount, and Rs 5,000 corporate offer. Priced at Rs 6.89-11.49 lakh, the Altroz facelift remains the only hatchback in India to currently offer a diesel engine, and rivals  the Maruti Suzuki Baleno, Toyota Glanza, and Hyundai i20.

Tata Punch discounts in June 2025

Up to Rs 28,000 off

Tata’s smallest SUV, the Punch, has total benefits of up to Rs 28,000 - comprised of a Rs 25,000 cash discount and Rs 3,000 corporate offer - on MY2024 models in June. MY2025 Punch models, meanwhile, get a Rs 10,000 cash discount, Rs 15,000 exchange/scrappage bonus, and Rs 3,000 corporate offer, making for maximum benefits of Rs 28,000. Prices for the Hyundai Exter rival start at Rs 6.20 lakh and go up to Rs 10.32 lakh.

Tata Nexon discounts in June 2025

Up to Rs 45,000 off

The Nexon has benefits of up to Rs 45,000 on MY2024 models, which includes a Rs 35,000 cash discount and Rs 10,000 exchange/scrappage bonus. Meanwhile, MY2025 Nexon models offer only an exchange/scrappage bonus of Rs 15,000. Notably, the Nexon does not get any corporate offers this month. Priced between Rs 8 lakh and Rs 15.60 lakh, the Nexon rivals the Skoda Kylaq, Kia Sonet, and Mahindra XUV 3XO.

Tata Tiago, Tigor discounts in June 2025

Up to Rs 50,000 off

Tata’s most affordable offerings - the Tiago and Tigor - get maximum discounts of up to Rs 40,000 and Rs 50,000 respectively on MY2024 stock. Meanwhile, MY2025 Tiagos (other than the base XE trim) and Tigors get total benefits of up to Rs 30,000 and Rs 35,000 respectively.  The Tiago price starts at Rs 5 lakh and tops off at Rs 8.85 lakh, while the Tigor compact sedan costs between Rs 6 lakh and Rs 9.55 lakh.

Tata Curvv discounts in June 2025

Up to Rs 30,000 off

All petrol and diesel variants of the Curvv made in 2024 get a cash discount of up to Rs 30,000 this June. There are, however, no benefits on MY2025 units of the Tata Curvv, nor does Tata offer any corporate discountsfor the coupe SUV. The Citroen Basalt and Hyundai Creta rival is currently priced between Rs 10 lakh and Rs 19.52 lakh, and got a Dark Edition back in April.

All prices, ex-showroom, India.
